description: The 2025 NFL season has started with Week 1 games, featuring notable player movements, key injuries, international games, and big expectations for teams after the offseason.
why_is_it_trending: The NFL 2025 season kickoff is always highly anticipated, marking the start of games that count after preseason off weeks and player preparation[1][3][4].

key_points: Opening weekend saw compelling matchups such as Detroit Lions pursuing a third consecutive NFC North title by visiting the Packers and other divisional battles[1][5].
Injured Miami Dolphins stars including Tyreek Hill, Darren Waller, and running back De'Von Achane are expected to play, influencing team prospects early on[3].
Dallas Cowboys adjust after trading Micah Parsons, hoping to rely on quarterback Dak Prescott and new wide receiver George Pickens for offensive firepower[4].
overlook_what_might_happen_next: The NFL trade deadline and signing cutoffs in November 2025 will shape roster configurations for playoff pushes, making the next months critical for team management[2].
Early performance in Week 1 provides insight into breakout teams and players to watch, with analysts predicting potential surprise playoff contestants based on initial games[4].
Continued NFL international games may increase the league's fanbase and influence, possibly leading to more overseas games and marketing expansions in coming seasons[2].
